result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephen B. Mintern

records.addlTxt: Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture and Forfeiture Hearing for Stephen Mintern

12:02 PM Defendant Stephen B. Mintern not in court.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court, via zoom for State of Wisconsin. State request warrant body, nationwide and moves to forfeit bond. Court notes def. received notice and will authorize warrant body only, nationwide. Court orders $5,000 cash bond be forfeited pending hearing.
Status conference on October 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:05 AM /Room 203/ Defendant Stephen B. Mintern not in court.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court reporter by zoom. Set for bond hearing, however defendant posted. State requests earlier status conference October 17th @ 11AM. Court will give notice to defendant's address on file. State notes offer letter and will include date. Recess 10:08 AM.
Bail/bond hearing on September 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:30 AM Defendant Stephen B. Mintern appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. Court notes bail/bond modification filed and request will have to be heard by Judge Rhode. Also, waiver of attorney rights filed and gone over with def. Def. questions court if he may hire an attorney at later date. Court advise rights.  Court finds waiver is freely & voluntarily given. State heard on next schedule activity. Court gives def two choices, set for p.h. or status cnf.  Def. request status cnf.  Def. waives time limits for p.h.  Court accepts waiver of time limits for p.h. DA will be working on an offer for defendant.  Bond request will be set by Judge Rhode.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Request for Bail Reduction
(Routed to CC's JA)

2:33 PM Defendant Stephen B. Mintern appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews history of case.  Def. would like to represent himself.  Court advise def. he needs to complete waiver of atty form.  Victim rights complied. Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No illegal use or possession of controlled substances. Cooperate with the Langlade County Department of Social Services.

1:04 PM/Room 203.  Defendant Stephen B. Mintern appeared by video, in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. State heard on bond, recommends $5,000 cash bond with conditions maintain absolute sobriety, no illegal use or possession of controlled substances, cooperate with the Langlade County Department of Social Services. Def. heard on bond. Remarks by the Court. The Court orders $5,000 cash bond with conditions as requested.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
